text: Bossiaea arenicola is a perennial shrub in the pea family (Fabaceae), which is native to Queensland. The species was first described as Bossiaea arenicola in 1991 by J.H. Ross. The name has not been revised, and nor are there any synonyms. An isotype is held at the Australian National Herbarium, CANB 405041, collected by J.R. Clarkson on 14 June 1984, 4.3 km east of the Hopevale-Starke Road on the track to the McIvor River mouth (Queensland). == References == == External links == * The Australasian Virtual Herbarium – Bossiaea arenicola occurrence data * Thompson, I.R. (2012) A revision of eastern Australian Bossiaea (Fabaceae: Bossiaeae). Muelleria 30(2): 106-174 (pp.157-158) arenicola Category:Flora of Queensland Category:Plants described in 1991
title: Bossiaea arenicola
